org.svvrl.goal.core.comp.ms
Class MSTree

java.lang.Object
  org.svvrl.goal.core.comp.ms.MSTree
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class MSTree
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

This class provides an implementation of the Muller-Schupp binary tree [David E. Muller, Paul E. Schupp: Simulating Alternating Tree Automata by Nondeterministic Automata: New Results and New Proofs of the Theorems of Rabin, McNaughton and Safra. Theoretical Computer Science. 141(1&2): 69-107. 1995].

Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

          The name of Muller-Schupp trees.

          Constructs this tree with an NBW to be determinized and a label of the root of this tree.

createNode

public Node createNode(StateSet label)
Returns a new node with a specified label. The name of the returned node will be new in this tree.

Parameters:
label - the label of the returned node
Returns:
a new node in this tree with parent parent and label label

removeNode

public void removeNode(Node node)
Removes a node and all its descendants from this tree recursively. All the green nodes removed will also be removed from the green node cache of this tree. All the names of the removed nodes will also be released.

Parameters:
node - the node to be removed from this tree

changeGreenToYellow

public void changeGreenToYellow()
Changes the green nodes to yellow nodes. This method will clear the green node cache of this tree.

move

public void move(java.lang.String symbol)
Moves the tree one-step forward with respect to a symbol and spawn two children for each leaf node. The new leaf nodes will be colored and the new green leaf nodes will be added to the green node cache of this tree.

Parameters:
symbol - a symbol in the alphabet of the input NBW

merge

public void merge()
Removes a state from a node and all the ndoe's descendants if the state is contained in some left node at the same height in this tree.

shrink

public void shrink()
Removes nodes only on paths to empty nodes and if a node has only one child, merges the node with its child and colors the node green if its child has color green or yellow. The green nodes removed will also be removed from the green node cache of this tree. The new green nodes will be added to the green node cache of this tree. The names of removed nodes will be released.
